Package neureka

Interface Data<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of the data array.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DeviceData<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDeviceData
    public interface Data<V>
    A wrapper type for the raw data array of a tensor/nd-array, which is typically provided by implementations of the Device interface. Every tensor/nd-array has a Data object which it uses to access its raw data. Use this to access the raw data of a nd-array and to check where it currently resides. But be careful as this exposes mutable state as well as backend specific implementations and types (e.g. OpenCL / JVM arrays).

      • owner

        Device<V> owner()
        Returns:
        The owner of this data array wrapper (the device which allocated the memory).

      • getOrNull

        java.lang.Object getOrNull()
        This returns the underlying raw data object of a nd-array or tensor of a backend specific type (e.g. OpenCL memory object or JVM array). Contrary to the Nda.getItems() ()} method, this will return an unbiased view on the raw data of this tensor. Be careful using this, as it exposes mutable state!
        Returns:
        The raw data object underlying a nd-array/tensor, or null if the data is not present.

      • get

        default java.lang.Object get()
        This returns the underlying raw data object of a nd-array or tensor of a backend specific type (e.g. OpenCL memory object or JVM array). Contrary to the Nda.getItems() ()} method, this will return an unbiased view on the raw data of this tensor. Be careful using this, as it exposes mutable state!
        Returns:
        The raw data object underlying a nd-array/tensor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the data reference is null.

      • as

        default <D> D as​(java.lang.Class<D> dataType)
        This returns the underlying raw data object of a nd-array or tensor. Contrary to the Nda.getItems() ()} method, this will return an unbiased view on the raw data of this tensor. Be careful using this, as it exposes mutable state!
        Parameters:
        dataType - The type the underlying reference object is expected to have (this may be a JVM array or something device specific).
        Returns:
        The raw data object underlying a nd-array/tensor.

      • dataType

        DataType<V> dataType()
        Returns:
        The data type of the raw data array.

      • usages

        int usages()
        This method returns the number of times this data object is currently in use by a nd-array, meaning that the number of usages is also the number of nd-arrays which are currently referencing this data object.
        The reason why this can be greater than one is because of the existence of sliced, transposed and reshaped nd-arrays which all share the same data object as their parent nd-array.
        Returns:
        The number of times this data object is currently in use by a nd-array.
